content.question: Directions: Read the following passages carefully and answer ALL of the questions. When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must: write out the Latin and/or cite line numbers. AND translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin. Daedalus, ut fama est, fugiens Minoia regna, praepetibus pennis ausus se credere caelo insuetum per iter gelidas enavit ad Arctos, Chalcidicaque levis tandem super astitit arce. (5) Redditus his primum terris tibi, Phoebe, sacravit remigium alarum posuitque immania templa. 1. Lines 1-4 describe Daedalus' escape from Crete. Translate insuetum (line 3) and explain why this adjective is used to describe Daedalus' route (iter, line 3).

frqParts.text: Directions: Read the following passages carefully and answer ALL of the questions. When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must: write out the Latin and/or cite line numbers. AND translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin. Daedalus, ut fama est, fugiens Minoia regna, praepetibus pennis ausus se credere caelo insuetum per iter gelidas enavit ad Arctos, Chalcidicaque levis tandem super astitit arce. (5) Redditus his primum terris tibi, Phoebe, sacravit remigium alarum posuitque immania templa. 1. Lines 1-4 describe Daedalus' escape from Crete. Translate insuetum (line 3) and explain why this adjective is used to describe Daedalus' route (iter, line 3).
2. Define apostrophe and identify an example of it in this passage. Write out the Latin that illustrates this figure of speech.
3. Upon his safe arrival, Daedalus offered thanks to his patron, Apollo. According to lines 5-6, what two gifts did he offer to Apollo? Refer specifically to the Latin to support your answer.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
